intro: Bartsia elongata, commonly known as the slender bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or purple in color. Bartsia elongata is known for its ability to form dense colonies, which can affect the growth of surrounding vegetation.
